text: we're in an historic drought and that
demands unprecedented action it's for
that reason that I'm issuing an
executive order mandating substantial
water reduction across our state as
Californians we have to pull together
and save water in every way we can this
executive order which I've signed today
it's long it covers a number of
different details in fact I've never
seen one quite like it before it's going
to save water by mandating real
reductions in a number of areas it's
going to affect golf courses people's
lawns universities campuses there will
be mandatory or if people will do it or
there'll be cease and desist orders that
local water districts can issue there
can be fines and I would hope that we
don't see this in some period of way but
that we see the challenge California is
a pioneering state people have come here
to build a life and together we're gonna
build a continuously better life but
that means conservation it means
innovation and it means collaborating on
the farm and in the city and in the
mountains in a way that we take into
account reality look for over 10,000
years some people say for 20,000 years
people lived in California but the
number of those people were never more
than three or four hundred thousand as
far as we know they live much simpler
they were able to move when drought
occurred or fires occurred they could
cope now we are embarked on upon an
experiment that no one has ever tried
ever in the history of mankind and that
is 38 million people with 32 million
vehicles living at the level of comfort
that we all strive to attain
Oh
